question: Which of the following is a hindrance to the democratization of the United Nations?
explanation:
A hindrance to the democratization of the United Nations is Resistance of the big powers.

It is the five permanent members of the Security Council that is usually referred to as the big powers. The big five are as follows:

1. U.S.A
2. Britain
3. Russia
4. China and
5. France.

Each of the five permanent members of this Security Council has a veto power. In most cases this could be used to satisfy their respective selfish interest at the expense of fulfilling the objectives of the Organization. The United Nations has in most cases proved helpless in cases of aggression involving big powers . For example America invaded Vietnam and Iraq. The defunct Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR) also once invaded Afghanistan but nothing was done by the United Nations Organization in each case. Again the United Nation's Power of sanction is often ignored by member states especially the big powers. For instance, when economic sanction was placed on a country such as in South Africa during the period of apartheid policy, some member states such as Britain still traded with the country.

So it should be clearly realized that the veto power and permanent status of some member states in the Security Council is highly discriminatory and undemocratic.
options: Proliferation of weapons of mass destruction
Delayed payment of annual dues by members

question: An essential principle that guides the activities of the United Nations is
explanation:
An essential principle that guides the activities of the United Nations is respect for the sovereign equality of member states.

This Stands to reason that all the member states of the United Nations are sovereign and equal. No state will be too big to dominate others and no state would be too small to be recognized.
options: the protection of the United States of America against terrorism
respect for the sovereign equality of member states
the transfer of technology to developing countries

explanation: The African Union was established to consolidate Africa's position in global politics

explanation: A principal defect of the Commonwealth is lack of commitment among member states. question: Nigeria declared that she would not attend the OAU summit in Tripoli in 1982 unless
explanation:
Nigeria declared that she would not attend the OAU summit in Tripoli in 1982 unless Libya withdrew her troops from Chad, but this was not done. This was during Shehu Shagari's administration.

In fact, the President did the imprecedented by boy cotting two summits in succession on what some writers described as ''some spurious grounds'' The boycotts were in Nairobi in 1981 and then that of Tripoli in 1982.

Libya withdrew her troops from Chad

question: Nigeria's non-aligned policy was criticized because of the
explanation:
Nigeria's non-aligned policy was criticized because of the Anglo-Nigerian Defence Pact.

This Pact was signed during the Balewa government. But due to very stiff opposition and pressure from pressure groups such as student's Union, the Pact was abrogated in 1962.

question: NEPAD was adopted during the OAU summit held in
explanation:
The 37th OAU Summit in Lusaka, Zambia in July 2001 adopted the New Partnership for Africa's Development (NEPAD), as the integrated and comprehensive socio-economic development programme to accelerate Africa's renewal, in the form of Declaration 1 (XXXVII).

The Lusaka Summit also agreed on the creation of the Heads of State and Government Implementiation Committee (HSGIC), which in turn established the NEPAD Steering Committee and the NEPAD Secretariat to coordinate and administer its activities.

explanation: Ethics and accountability in government can be guaranteed through due process and transparency.

question: The process of law-making by the legislature begins with
explanation:
The process of law-making by the legislature begins as follows:

First and Fore most, the initiator of the bill will have to notify the clerk of the House by making sure that the draft of the bill reached him, the clerk of the House will then notify the members of Parliament about the presence of such bill.

The clerk of the House will read out the title of the bill. It will then be printed out in leaflets and circulated to all members for them to study before the second reading which the date will also be fixed.

question: A non-permanent feature of a state is
explanation:
Government is a non-permanent feature of a state.

It should be noted that Periodic Change is one of the major characteristics of government. No government is permanent especially, one that is based on peoples participation - elective government. That is the adoption of periodic free and fair elections. In some cases, it could be either four or five years to change a government.

question: The ancient Greeks practised
explanation:
The Ancient Greeks practised Direct Democracy.

This was practised in Ancient Athens, One of the city states in Greece. This was possible due to the fact that the population was small by then, and ever body had the right to say his opinion on any governmental matter in the national assembly.

question: The formation of confederations is based primarily on
explanation:
The formation of confederations is based primarily on security considerations confederation is mostly meant to guarantee external and internal security of the confederal states.

Examples of countries that have practised it are as follows:

1. The League of Nations

2. USA (1781 - 1789)

3. Germany (1815 - 1866)

4. Senegal and Gambia (1984) etc.

question: The declaration of election results is the exclusive duty of
explanation:
The declaration of election results is the exclusive duty of electoral commissions.

The Commission conducts the elections, count the votes and then published the results of the elections.

Other functions of the Electoral Commission include.

1. Division of the country into constituencies

2. Registration of voters

3. Determination of the type of voting

4. Building or supply of Polling Booths.

5. Provision of Election Materials

6. Display and Revision of Voter's Lists

7. Registration of Political Parties.

8. Appointment and Training of Electoral Officers.

9. Enlightens and Educates the Voters

10. Disbursement of Grants

11. Sees about Auditing of Accounts.

question: The traditions of a people that shape their government and politics represent their
explanation:
The traditions of a people that shape their government and politics represent their political culture.

Political culture refers to the attitudes, emotions, values and all those aspects of the peoples culture which relate to politics and government. It deals with the people's participation in politics and their relations to political institutions like the arms of government.

On the other hand, the belief system of each tribe has major impact on the people's political culture, thus bringing about the differences of political culture. For example. ethnic differences have political attitudes in Nigeria for long. It should then be realized that Different Ethnicity is one of the determinants of political culture.

question: According to Karl Marx,the mode of production that precedes capitalism is
explanation:
According to Karl Marx,the mode of production that precedes capitalism is socialism.

Socialism is associated with KarlÂ Marx and his basic ideas are used in socialist states. His theory is in most cases referred to as Marxism. Historical Materialism and Dialectical Materialism. Kari Marx maintained that each productive process has it mode of socio-economic relation. The various stages of production undergone by societies had their different modes of production. Such stages which every society must have to pass through include communalism, Feudalism and capitalism. Socialism came up as a protest movement against the evils of capitalism.

question: The executive is mainly concerned with the
explanation:
The Executive is mainly concerned with the implementation of policies.

The structure of government include:

1. The Legislature - which makes laws

2. The Executive - which is responsible for formulation and implementation of policies and

question: A distinguishing feature of a federal state is
explanation:
A Written Constitution is a distinguishing feature of federal state.

The federal state always go by written and right constitution so as to avoid manipulation. The amendment procedures of this type of constitution is always complicated and rigorous.

explanation: The recognition and general acceptance of the right to rule in a country based on laid down regulations is known as legitimate authority

explanation:
Fascism is a political ideology that advocates extreme nationalism and suppression of individual liberties.

It is a system of government which stresses on the supremacy of state over the individual and also the superiority of its own race over the races of other countries it was founded by an Italian leader known as Benito Mussolini. Adolf Hitler of Germany also believed in the theory but he referred to his own version as Nazism

Fascism started in Italy in 1922 and dissolved in the year 1943.

question: A constitution is classified as rigid if
explanation:
A constitution is classified as rigid if it requires special procedures to amend.

A rigid constitution cannot be amended or changed so easily due to its special stringent and cumbersome procedures of amendment. It should be noted that not all sections of rigid constitution are difficult to amend.

Some countries with rigid constitution are as follows:

1. United States of America (U.S.A)

2. France

3. Canada

4. Australia

5. Ghana

6. Switzerland

7. Sierra Leone

8. Gambia

9. Nigeria, etc.
options: it requires special procedures to amend
its core provisions are made by decree
all its provisions cannot be amended
any of its provisions can be amended

explanation:

question: One of the objectives of a multi party system is to
explanation:
One of the objectives of a multi party system is to provide alternatives.

Multiparty gives wide range of choice to the electorate. Just as there are many parties, for the voters, there are also many attractive political manifestoes to choose from.

question: A constitution formulated and imposed on a country without popular participation is said to be created by
explanation:
A constitution formulated and imposed on a country without popular participation is said to be created by Decree.

Decree is law made by the Federal Military Government.

All military administrations are dictatorship. They rule by decrees that in most cases, may not be challenged in any count of law.

The military administration is not accountable to the people, does not listen to public opinion. They pass their laws through Decrees without any regard to the feelings of the masses. In most cases, their decrees contain some ouster clauses that render the judiciary powerless.

question: In a parliamentary system,the term shadow cabinet is often used to refer to
explanation:
In a parliamentary system,the term shadow cabinet is often used to refer to portfolio designates of the party in opposition.

Shadow Cabinet is done by the opposition party. This is by forming their own executive getting ready to control the government if the government in power happens to fail.

The Shadow Cabinet or Shadow government is also opposition which is officially recognized in a cabinet system of government. Such government criticisms the activities of the government in power.
options: deputy prime ministers and assistant ministers
rebellious members of the ruling party
portfolio designates of the party in opposition

question: Which of the following made the earliest contact with the Nigerian society?
explanation:
The Portuguese made the earliest contact with the Nigerian society. They were the first foreigners definitely known to have visited West Africa by sea.

In the fifteenth century A.D. the Europeans made their first recorded visit to West Africa including Nigeria with immediate and important results. As far as one man was responsible for this event, the credit must eventually go to Prince Henry of Portugal, who later became known as Henry the Navigator.

According to C.R. Niven in his book titled A Short History of Nigeria (1962), ''the King of Portugal made a contract in the middle of the fifteenth century with one Fernao Gomez, where by the later agreed to explore one hundred leagues every year starting from Sierra Leone and working towards along the coast. Ruy de Sequeira who was in command of one of his expeditions, reached Lagos in the year 1472.

question: The adoption of a federal system of government in Nigeria under colonial rule was necessitated mainly by
explanation:
The adoption of a federal system of government in Nigeria under colonial rule was necessitated mainly by Administrative convenience. another was cultural diversity.

In 1946, Arthur Richard made some constitutional proposals for the country such as:

1. Providing adequately for the diverse elements making up the people within that unit

2. Dividing the country into three administrative units or regions.

question: Public corporations are established mainly to
explanation:
Public Corporations are established mainly to provide services at subsidized rates.

Looking into the definition of Public Corporations, it should be realized that they are business organizations which are set up by an Act of Parliament or Decree to provide certain social welfare services for the public which if provided by private entrepreneurs will be very costly.

One of the major reasons for setting up Public corporations is to provide essential goods and services at cheaper rates for the people. Another is to protect the consumers from Shylock traders and manufacturers, provision of employment opportunities etc.

question: Indirect Rule as a British colonial policy was first introduced in
explanation:
Indirect Rule as a British colonial policy was first introduced in India.

Lord Lugard, earlier in his colonial service, tried the Indirect system in India and it worked well. He then introduced the system in Nigeria due to the fact that he observed similar traits in Nigeria as he saw in India. So he thought that the system would also work in Nigeria.

explanation: Following the 1976 Local Government reforms in Nigeria,the Local governments were empowered to promulgate and enforce. Bye-laws.

explanation:

It may also be defined as institutions of government through which local affairs are managed by local people under a law made for that purpose by the central Government.

It should then be noted that every thing centres on the federal government and as such, the National Assembly has to debate on the bill which will be signed into law by the President.

explanation:
The Pre-Colonial Igbo political system was largely Republican.

Apart from Igbos of Onitsha. question: Which of the following states were created in 1996?
explanation:
Gombe and Zamfara were the states created in 1996.

On October, 1, General Sani Abacha announced the creation of six more states and the states were as follows:

1. Ekiti State

2. Ebonyi State

3. Bayalsa State

4. Nassarawa State

5. Zamfara State and

6. Gombe State.

This brought the number of states in Nigeria to 36 at present.

question: Acculturation in colonial administration was associated with the
explanation:
Acculturation in colonial administration was associated with the French policy of assimilation.

The French adopted the policy in all their territories. The ides was to rule the people directly and if possible, introduce the French ways of life to their colonial subjects. This was to maintain their claim that French culture was the best in the whole human race, Thus, they set about acculturating their subjects and tried to turn them into Black- French men and women.

In other words, the French Policy of Assimilation was the type of colonial administration which the French government imposed on its West African Colonies. The system was meant to replace the culture of West Africans with that of the French people.

question: Military disengagement from politics is always preceded by
explanation:
Military disengagement from politics is always preceded by the making of a new constitution.

It should be noted that the following steps were taken by the military to return Nigeria to Civil rule in October, first, 1979.

1. Setting up Constitution Drafting Committee

2. Inaugurating a Constituent Assembly to ratify the draft constitution.

3. Establishment of Elections Commission (FEDECO)

4. Local Government Elections on Non-Party Basis in 1976.

5. Lifting of Ban on Political Activities

6. Registration of Political Parties.

7. The conduct of General Elections is 1979

8. Swearing in of the Elected President and the State governors in October, 1979.
options: the making of a new constitution

question: The principle of federal character was first enunciated in the
explanation:
The principle of federal character was first enunciated in the 1979 Constitution.

This stands to reason that the appointments of government personnel into any Federal establishment or agency or as a minister is to be done to reflect the federal Character. This means that appointments should spread across the entire country.

The Constitution:
The Federal Character Commission to have a Chairman and one person to represent each of the states and Federal Capital Territory, Abuja.

The Responsibility of the Commission:
To work out equitable formula which should be subject to approval by the National Assembly for the distribution of all cadres of posts in the Public Services of the federation and the states, armed forces, the police and other relevant government organizations.

question: The final court of appeal in Nigeria during the colonial era was the
explanation:
The Privy Council was the final Court of Appeal in during the colonial era.

It should be recalled that one of the major weaknesses of Independence Constitution of 1960 was that the Supreme Court was not the court of last resort as it it today. Instead the Judicial Committee of the Privy Council in Britain continued to act as the highest Court of Appeal for Nigeria

explanation:

question: The major objective of the manifesto of the People's Redemption Party in the Second Republic was
explanation:
Emancipation of the Masses was the major objective of the manifesto of the People's Redemption Party in the second Republic.

P.R.P. was founded by Late Mallam Aminu Kano on the 21st of October 1978.
The Aims and objectives were as follows:

1. To liberate the people from the subjugation of the super powers.

2. To identify the basic factors of Modern Nigerian Life.

Infact the P.R.P. was Mass Party which was out to improve the lots of the poor, the isolated as well as village dwellers.

Mallam Aminu Kano was the Chairman of the National Executive Committee. He was also the party's. P.R.P. Presidential Aspirant during the 1979 Presidential Elections.

explanation: The privatization of public corporations in Nigeria is undertaken by the Bureau of Public Enterprise

explanation:
The main goal of the NNDP was to agitate for Nigeria's independence.

It should be recalled that another aim of NNDP was to cooperate with and work hand in hand with the National Congress for British West Africa (NCBWA). One of the major aims of this National Congress of British West Africa was to achieve political Independence for British West Africa.

question: The Structural Adjustment Programme was introduced by the
explanation:
The Structural Adjustment Programme was introduced by the Babangida Regime.

The aim was to revamp the ailing economy of Nigeria.

The Structural Adjustment Programme (SAP) came into effect on Friday, 27th June 1986. That was after Nigeria declared a state of economic emergency in October 1985.

Implementation of SAP:
Some of the ways are follows:

1. Devaluation of naria.

2. Privatization of Government enterprises

3. Rescheduling of external debts

4. Establishment of the National Directorate of Employment (NDE) and the Directorate of Foods, Roads and Rural Infrastructure (DFRRI)

5. Withdrawal of subsidies from petroleum products

6. Promotion of domestic production of goods

7. Deregulation of interest rates

8. Export Promotion

9. Civil Service Reforms

Aims and Objectives of SAP

1. Reduction of oil-dependency

2. Reduce Imports

3. Diversify the productive base

4. Reduce the burden on debt

5. Foster non-inflationary growth

6. To secure more realistic exchange rate for naira

7. To increase employment opportunities.

question: The Ogboni cult in the pre-colonial Yoruba political system played the role of the
explanation:
The Ogboni cult in the pre-colonial Yoruba political system played the role of the Judiciary.

The Ogboni was the third organ of government of old Oyo Empire. It was a secret society, made up of prominent diviners and headed by the Oluwo. One of their constitutional functions was to check the excesses of the Oyemesi, such as the rejection of an Alaafiri. It was also its duty to mediate between the Alaafiri and the Oyemesi. The Ogboni performed judicial functions especially on cases involving spilling of blood.

question: The head of the electoral body that conducted the June 12 1993 elections was
explanation:
Humphrey Nwosu was the head of the electoral body that conducted the June 12 1993 elections.

Two political parties were set up by Babangida administration

1. The Social Democratic Party (SDP) and

2. The National Republican Convention (NRC). A set of elections were held to fill all officers at the local and state government levels. After series of delays, Ibrahim Babangida agreed at last to hold the Presidential election on June 12, 1993, the election was widely believed to have been won by Chief MKO Abiola of SDP. On June 23, the Babangida administration annulled the election, that is the Presidential Election results were fully announced by the NEC Chairman, Humphrey Nwosu.

question: Ethnic politics in Nigeria can be traced to the
explanation:
Ethnic politics in Nigeria can be traced to the Richard's Constitution.

The Constitution did not promote the unity of Nigeria due to the fact that the division of the country into three administrative units isolated the people more instead of uniting them as he had proposed. For this, Richard had been seriously accused of introducing tribal politics and regionalism in Nigerian body politic.

The constitution provided for three unequal regions and so laid the ugly foundation for tribalism or ethnicism in the country. It should then be strongly believed that this later led to the Nigerian civil war which started on 6th July, 1967 and came to an end on 12th January 1970.
